LanguageData.PaperclipFactory_HelpText: The EMC factory doesn't just take in steel - it can make EMC from any item by manipulating its subatomic structure. The number of EMC produced is equivalent to 1/4 of the combined mass of the ingredients.
LanguageData.PaperclipFactory_OrdoText: Ordo Historia Standardization Archive - OHS 15616 - A paperclip used as feedstock for a standard atomic 3d printing device(OHS 6011) Section 1.1 - Physical properties - A single paperclip must weigh 1.0 ± 1*10^-8 grams. - It can be made out of any form of matter, including exotic matter(OHS 11279) such as Dalekanium, Unobtainium or Vibranium; however, the end product has to exhibit the properties of a metal such that it is pliable, ductile and malleable. - Paperclips must have a positive real mass. - For instructions about how to manufacture a paperclip, see the Lantz-Foddy method for producing paperclips from matter(OHS 58281) - Paperclips mus[TRANSMISSION ABORTED - POTENTIAL SECURITY BREACH DETECTED]
LanguageData.PRFPaperclipPowerGenerator_HelpText: The EMC power generator is just like a normal power generator, except it runs off EMC and has 2 extra features:\n1. You can adjust the fuel consumption rate to ramp up/down the power production.\n2. After unlocking "EMC power generator: self-improvement" in research, power production efficiency can slowly ramp up, as long as the building has fuel and is powered at all times.
LanguageData.AtomicReconstructor_HelpText:
The atomic reconstructor turns EMC into items. Simply fuel it up, add power, set the item you want to produce and wait. You can also make it work faster by adjusting the slider. Note that the speed is directly proportional to the square of the EMC cost, for example if you set the speed to 2x, it will use 4x more EMC.

Generally, items that are more expensive take longer to make, and items that are heavier cost more EMC.

Note: The atomic reconstructor cannot make any items that have to be made from a material (for example, steel longsword)
LanguageData.PRFPaperclipDuplicator_HelpText:
Think of the EMC duplicator as a bank: it stores EMC and gives you a set interest on those EMC. The Duplicator tab provides an interface for you to deposit/withdraw EMC. Note that you need to provide a cargo platform as an item source for depositing/withdrawing EMC.

The formula that is used for calculating the current EMC amount is:
CurrentBalance = 1.05^(DaysPassed) * InitialBalance
LanguageData.PRF_Recycler_HelpText: This machine can recycle almost any apparel or weapon down to its raw resources with decent efficiency. Requires the output to be cleared so that new material can be ejected.
LanguageData.PRF_RecipeDatabase_HelpText:
To start importing recipes, place this near a powered worktable, go to "Import recipe...", and select the recipe you want to import.

Afterwards reinstall this near assembler(s) to share recipes.

Can store multiple recipes from different workbenches.
LanguageData.PRF_TypeOneAssembler_I_HelpText:
To get any assembler building set up, go to its "Bills" tab and add the bills you want in order. Then configure its output so that the yellow cell is where you want the products to go. Finally, place the required ingredients around it (if you're using a smart hopper, remember to check "toggle allow forbidden"), and give it power.

To feed recipes into this assembler, build a recipe database and place it next to the work table you want to copy bills from(See the recipe database help for additional instructions). Once finished with the import(s), reinstall it near this building.

Please note max level recipes for this assembler is: 10, art level is 9
LanguageData.PRF_TypeTwoAssembler_I_HelpText:
This assembler is special in that it gets faster and better quality at its recipes the more it works on them. Over time, however, this skill also decays exponentially.

To get any assembler building set up, go to its "Bills" tab and add the bills you want in order. Then configure its output so that the yellow cell is where you want the products to go. Finally, place the required ingredients around it (if you're using a smart hopper, remember to check "toggle allow forbidden"), and give it power.

To feed recipes into this assembler, build a recipe database and place it next to the work table you want to copy bills from. See the help for the recipe database for additional instructions. Once finished with the import(s), reinstall it near this building.

Please note max level recipes for this assembler is: 20, art level is 12
LanguageData.Lighting_FloorLampArrow_HelpText: Signs to indicate what direction things going or just decorate your room? Someone spilled glowy goo from bugs while making it so it have a slight glow to it
LanguageData.Lighting_RedFloorLampArrow_HelpText: Signs to indicate what direction things going or just decorate your room? Someone spilled glowy goo from bugs while making it so it have a slight glow to it
LanguageData.Lighting_GreenFloorLampArrow_HelpText: Signs to indicate what direction things going or just decorate your room? Someone spilled glowy goo from bugs while making it so it have a slight glow to it
LanguageData.Lighting_FloorLampX_HelpText: Signs to indicate what direction things going or just decorate your room? Someone spilled glowy goo from bugs while making it so it have a slight glow to it
LanguageData.PRF_Shearer_HelpText: Automatically harvests animals when they venture near the vicinity of the building. Store food as bait for the animals so that they wander nearby to be harvested.
LanguageData.PRF_Milker_HelpText: Automatically harvests animals when they venture near the vicinity of the building. Store food as bait for the animals so that they wander nearby to be harvested.
LanguageData.PRF_GenericAnimalHarvester_HelpText: Automatically harvests animals when they venture near the vicinity of the building. Store food as bait for the animals so that they wander nearby to be harvested..
LanguageData.PRF_Slaughterhouse_HelpText: Automatically slaughters animals if they meet a specified criteria: Exceeding a specified number, age or gender. Good in combination with "Auto Meat Grinder" and "Animal stations"
LanguageData.PRF_BillTypeMiner_I_HelpText: This is a highly customizable miner that can be suited to needs with newest spacer technology.
LanguageData.PRF_DeepQuarry_mkIII_HelpText: This quarry will extract random rare ores from the ground: From steel to gold. \n(Please note if any mod is added that adds ores those will be mined here too including stone type, that will need a patch to fix.)
LanguageData.PRF_DeepQuarry_mkII_helpText: The deep quarry is used for extraction of random mineral resources from underground, and produces a resource on average once every 6 hours. It functions like a colonist miner would - it randomly selects a rock or compacted resource (Granite, compacted steel) according to commonality and returns its mined products. Hence, rock chunks are the most common products of deep quarries, followed by the various commonalities of other resources.
LanguageData.PRF_DeepQuarry_mkI_HelpText: The deep quarry is used for extraction of random mineral resources from underground, and produces a resource on average once every 6 hours. It functions like a colonist miner would - it randomly selects a rock or compacted resource (Granite, compacted steel) according to commonality and returns its mined products. Hence, rock chunks are the most common products of deep quarries, followed by the various commonalities of other resources.
LanguageData.PRF_SelfPrepper_HelpText: An automatic food preparation table made originally for VGP Gourmet, but will be featured in other mods and maybe vanilla too. Input raw food, output ingredients to make food.
LanguageData.PRF_MeatGrinder_HelpText: This dangerous-looking machine works by putting in dead animals, outputting meat, hide, and any other byproduct. Remove fast from output to avoid clogging, as only one item can be output at time.
LanguageData.PRF_SelfCookerI_HelpText:
To get any simple assembler building set up, go to its "Bills" tab and add the bills you want in order. Then configure its output so that the yellow cell is where you want the products to go. Finally, place the required ingredients around it (if you're using a smart hopper, remember to check "toggle allow forbidden"), and give it power.

Please note max level recipes for this assembler is: 8

It will ONLY cook simple foods upgrade to get more complicated food types.
LanguageData.PRF_SelfCookerII_HelpText:
To get any simple assembler building set up, go to its "Bills" tab and add the bills you want in order. Then configure its output so that the yellow cell is where you want the products to go. Finally, place the required ingredients around it (if you're using a smart hopper, remember to check "toggle allow forbidden"), and give it power.

Please note max level recipes for this assembler is: 12

This one copies entire Electric stoves recipes + a few custom added. but ONLY upto level 12 cooking.
LanguageData.PRF_SelfCookerIII_HelpText:
To get any simple assembler building set up, go to its "Bills" tab and add the bills you want in order. Then configure its output so that the yellow cell is where you want the products to go. Finally, place the required ingredients around it (if you're using a smart hopper, remember to check "toggle allow forbidden"), and give it power.

Please note max level recipes for this assembler is: 20

This one copies entire Electric stoves recipes + a few custom added. and can NEVER spoil or poison a meal.
LanguageData.PRF_FermentingBarrel_HelpText: To get this building set up, go to the “Bills” tab and aldd the bills you want in order. Then configure the output so that the yellow cell is where you want the beer to be placed after fermentation. Finally, place wort around it (if you are using a smart hopper, remember to check toggle “allow forbidden”), and give it power.
LanguageData.PRF_WoodCrate_II_HelpText: To output to crates and cargo platforms with the "Industrial Rollers" mod, remember to use a roller pusher at the end.
LanguageData.PRF_SteelCrate_I_HelpText: Tiny steel crates, useful for tight spaces.
LanguageData.PRF_SteelCrate_II_HelpText: To output to crates and cargo platforms with the "Industrial Rollers" mod, remember to use a roller pusher at the end.
LanguageData.PRF_DigitalStorageUnit_I_HelpText:
The Industrial Storage unit (DSU) functions like any other storage building, except all items put inside are moved to the middle cell, allowing for virtually infinite storage capacity. There’s a limit set in mod setting, if set too high it might lag.

To prevent considerable lag in heavily used cargo platforms, the item readout in the "Items" tab only displays the first 500 items. You can, however, search for the item you want using the search bar.

NOTE: To output to crates and cargo platforms with the "Industrial Rollers" mod, remember to use a roller pusher at the end.
To set direct DSU output right-click the desired output item in the DSU item list to have it move to the DSU output cell. 
You can also right click and select a pawn and force wear to equip items from storage

 Pawn acces button forbid pawn to go directly into DSU and only use I/O
LanguageData.PRF_IOPort_I_HelpText: To configure the storage unit I/O port, set the mode (input or output), and the unit you want to connect to. If you choose output, remember to also select the item that you want to pull.\nYou can use right click on storage tab to directly output that item/stack eq. a weapon, into selected I/O port.
LanguageData.PRF_IOPort_IFridge_HelpText: This works like I/O port \n IT have a strange behavior with RimFridge comp i need to look at, if not working try set cargo platform again and swap in/out and make sure settings are ok, it should work with some fiddeling. (looking for a fix)
LanguageData.PRF_Conveyor_Simple_I_HelpText:
Conveyor belts will send items along their path. They automatically connect to other belts, including other belts facing different directions, excluding belts facing each other. You can split stacks or selectively filter items to other belts using belt splitters (so long as the belt and splitter are both above or below ground). Linking above and below ground belts requires a subterranean entrance or exit, but pullers do not require this conversion regardless of their position.

 Belts are not sophisticated, they will shove the objects into any empty space in front of it, including storage containers and stockpiles. They also do not obey filter settings, this function requires using pullers.

You can set any segment as the "end belt" in settings to make the item stop in order to be used by an assembler, this does not require a shelf or hopper.
LanguageData.PRF_Conveyor_Wall_I_HelpText: Wall conveyor belts function similarly to standard conveyor belts except that they keep rooms insulated from one another. They work in conjunction with all puller types and link seamlessly with standard belts. You can direct their output into storage without using a puller.
LanguageData.PRF_Conveyor_UG_I_HelpText: Underground belts are capable of going under machinery and walls without issue. However, they do not interact with standard belts unless linked with subterranean entrances and exits. Underground belts also require the use of a puller or subterranean exit in order to retrieve items from underground. Keep in mind that splitters must also match: Above ground belts use above ground splitters, and underground belts use underground splitters respectively.
LanguageData.PRF_Conveyor_Connector_To_UG_HelpText: Underground entrance: Required for use to merge standard belts with underground belts, however they are not required in order to iniate any length of underground belt. In other words, you can link an above ground puller directly to standard underground belt to send it underground.
LanguageData.PRF_Conveyor_Connector_To_Floor_HelpText: Underground exit: Required by underground belts in order to exit or interact with above ground storage, stockpiles, and belts. Without an exit, an unterminated underground belt will carry items until something pulls it or another section of underground belt is added.
LanguageData.PRF_Conveyor_Splitter_I_HelpText: Conveyer belt splitters work by splitting or filtering objects on a belt into two or three other directions. To do this, face the splitter away from your current belt then enable the output directions in settings. Each direction must be selected then enabled, and each direction has their own sets of filters. For instance: You can select North, enable North, and only select "chunks", then select and enable East, selecting everything but chunks. This would effectively filter any amount of chunks to the North, and the belt would continue East. With everything selected, the splitter splits stacks. With nothing selected, the splitter holds items.
LanguageData.PRF_FuelingMachine_HelpText:
The fueling machine is quite easy to use. Point the robotic arm (yellow cell) at the building/cannon you want to fuel, place fuel next to it (white cells) and give it power.
Refuels most standard refuelables.
It is also capable of fueling mortars and some modded mortars/turrets.
(Supports CE turrets and SoS Torpedos)
LanguageData.PRF_SimplePuller_I_HelpText:
A simple item puller, slower than later versions.
It can pull from belts, crates, DSU, stockpile zones, shelves, and smart hoppers. Is toggled off by default and requires being activated in order to function. Not required to terminate a belt into storage, but can help with more advanced logic. To get better control, set filters and settings. By default, pullers will not output if item is not allowed in target destination or if output is blocked by a wall or another item.

Yellow cell = output
White cell = input.
LanguageData.PRF_GrowzonePuller_I_HelpText: Works similarly to other pullers, but this one only is able to pull from growzones.
LanguageData.PRF_SimplePuller_II_HelpText: Latest-generation MKII pullers that have some more options than the Industrial Roller version. This can properly connect if IR cant.
LanguageData.PRF_SimplePuller_II_Wall_HelpText: This is walled version of the MKII puller. It has more options than the Industrial Roller version. This can properly connect if IR cant.
LanguageData.PRF_SimplePuller_II_Side_HelpText: An angled puller that works at 90 degree angles. Has similar features to the standard puller, with yellow cells as output and white cells as input. The direction can be changed after placing.Might be usefull in some cases
LanguageData.PRF_SmartHopper_HelpText: The Smart Hopper pulls in nearby items from theground or stockpile cells onto itself and holds until an assembler can use it.\n\n If you want to use it on a assembler, remember to enable the assembler's "toggle allow forbidden" option to allow assembler to pull from hopper.
LanguageData.PRF_DroneCultivator_I_HelpText:
Tier 1 Drone cultivator, your gateway to fully automated agriculture.

This one works by placing it within range of growing zones or hydroponics. It will work on all zones and crops in range without a problem. Tier 1 models will NOT autohaul harvested crops into storage, this is available at higher tier models after conducting the required Research.

Base Stats:
Drones: 1
WorkArea: 11x11
Jobtypes: Growing
Worktime: 1hour shifts
Skill lv.: 10
LanguageData.PRF_DroneCultivator_II_sun_HelpText: The cultivator operates automatically if it is given power. It will sow and harvest crops in growing zones and output them into ground, use a growzone puller to collect. If you also have the mod SeedsPlease installed, the cultivator requires seeds to be placed next to it for sowing to work.
LanguageData.PRF_OldTypeCultivator_I_HelpText: The cultivator operates automatically if it is given power. It will sow and harvest crops in growing zones and output them into a nearby cell. If you also have the mod SeedsPlease installed, the cultivator requires seeds to be placed next to it for sowing to work.
LanguageData.PRF_OldTypeCultivator_Sun_HelpText: The cultivator operates automatically if it is given power. It will sow and harvest crops in growing zones and output them into a nearby cell. If you also have the mod SeedsPlease installed, the cultivator requires seeds to be placed next to it for sowing to work.
LanguageData.PRF_Sprinkler_I_HelpText: The sprinkler randomly boosts the growth of crops and plants by 1 hour each round. You can see which cell it is currently working at by selecting it.
LanguageData.PRF_AutoCrafterSimple_HelpText:
S.A.L is a old type Assembler which are setup as a "stationary pawn" on any workbench Worker slot.
It will then start working on any bill setup in your workbench if it has required skill level and resource within its pulling range (white cells around it)

Each S.A.L has a preset set of skill and can perform certain task better than others, so pick the right one for the job.

S.A.L stands for Station Automation and logistics, and was a standalone mod before PRF was created. It featured Theese and Smart Hopper. But were abandonned due to new standalone assemblers which we use in here too. We thought there were still a use for these so we put them back.
LanguageData.PRF_AutoCrafter_HelpText:
S.A.L is a old type Assembler which are setup as a "stationary pawn" on any workbench Worker slot.
It will then start working on any bill setup in your workbench if it has required skill level and resource within its pulling range (white cells around it)

Each S.A.L has a preset set of skill and can perform certain task better than others, so pick the right one for the job.

It will then start working on any bill setup in your workbench if it has required skill level and resource within its pulling range (white cells around it)

Each S.A.L has a preset set of skill and can perform certain task better than others, so pick the right one for the job.

S.A.L is a old type Assembler which are setup as a "stationary pawn" on any workbench Worker slot.
It will then start working on any bill setup in your workbench if it has required skill level and resource within its pulling range (white cells around it)

Each S.A.L has a preset set of skill and can perform certain task better than others, so pick the right one for the job.
